Pre-Game Insights: The Detroit Tigers (66-66) welcome the Los Angeles Angels (54-77) at Comerica Park on Wednesday.
The odds on this game have Los Angeles at +135 and Detroit is at -161.
The pitchers taking the mound will be Griffin Canning and Kenta Maeda.
The Angels have tallied 193 two-baggers as a squad and have hit 128 baseballs out of the park.
Los Angeles has a slugging % of .371 and have been called out on strikes 1,122 times, while being walked on 388 occasions.
As a squad, the Los Angeles Angels are knocking in 3.9 runs per game, which has them at 27th in MLB.
The Angels have an ERA of 4.58 on the campaign (27th in MLB), and they have rung up 1,010 hitters.
Angels pitchers have conceded 156 long balls and 638 total runs (27th in MLB).
The Angels relievers have accumulated a save rate of 67.4% and has come into the game in 105 save situations.
The Detroit Tigers have an on-base percentage of .298 as well as a team batting average of .234 for the season.
Detroit has compiled 136 HRs for the year to go along with 541 runs batted in.
The Tigers have a team slugging percentage of .389 and they score 4.26 runs per game (18th in MLB).
The Detroit pitching staff have relinquished 549 runs so far this season while having an ERA of 3.83 (499 earned runs relinquished).
The Tigers are sitting with a team WHIP of 1.198 in addition to having a FIP of 3.76 as a team this year.
Detroit has called on relief pitchers to enter the game in 49 save chances and they have walked away with 29 saves.
The Tigers have racked up 1,118 assists, 69 errors and have accounted for 3,516 putouts this season.
Maeda (67-55 career record) holds a 4.17 earned run average and has conceded 8.0 hits per nine innings.
